alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 2:46PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH TOMORROW FOLLOWED BY COLD TEMPERATURES... Additional isolated to scattered snow showers will continue into Friday. Many areas will see an inch or less, though one to three inches are possible across some of the valleys across northeastern and east-central Nevada. Mountainous locations are expected to receive three to six inches or more of new snow. Breezy to locally windy conditions tonight into Friday will lead to blowing and drifting snow as well. While the holiday weekend looks to be on the drier side, confidence is high that much colder temperatures will be felt as highs will reach the the 20s to low 30s. Nighttime lows expected to dip into the single digits to single digits below zero Friday and Saturday night, though some of the colder locales could see double digit below zero readings. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
